info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Richmond and west central Aiken Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Augusta, or near Augusta, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Aiken Mall, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Clearwater, Belvedere, Martinez, Hephzibah, New Ellenton, Glendale, South Augusta, Midtown, Summerville, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Citizens Park, Augusta Regional Airport, Village Plaza Shopping Center and Augusta National Golf Club. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 195 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 18. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
